head.supplied: ¶ [...] ¶ ¶ On the death of Baron Mueller I wrote to the Victorian Government asking int he event of the manuscript for the Suppl. volume of the Fl. Aust. not being ready for the printer that it be ...

div.p: From Frederick Bailey to Fred Turner
Letter press copy book 3, p. 748, Queensland Herbarium, Brisbane.

On the death of Baron Mueller I wrote to the Victorian Government asking int he event of the manuscript for the Suppl. volume of the Fl. Aust. not being ready for the printer that it be handed over to me for completion. Now there have been obstacles thrown in the way to prevent me having the work, which has only, according to Luehmann (the late Baron's Chief Clerk) proceeded as far as the end of Thalamiflorae. I would have had it ready in two years; and it is now over 3 years since I gave way at the Baron's request. Luehmann suggests a conference consisting of himself, Tate, Maiden, & myself at Melbourne where he considers the work should be done by whoever was appointed to do it. I do not at all agree with this proposal so shall take no further interest in the matter. I only applied because I thought it my duty to do so being now the senior botanist of Australia. I start shortly on the preparation of a work on the flora of this colony.
